intro: Fuirena complotricha, commonly known as the false ginseng, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. The roots of Fuirena complotricha are sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine, though its medicinal properties remain largely unstudied.
